![Daegwallyeong Sheep Ranch (ÎåÄÍ¥ÄÎ†π ÏñëÎñºÎ™©Ïû•)](/2022-07-25-1658777504093/2365245_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Daegwallyeong Sheep Ranch is a privately owned ranch on an area of 195 k„é°. There are many ranches in Pyeongchang, but Daegwallyeong Sheep Ranch is the only ranch that raises sheep. The sheep grazing field is surrounded by a 1.2 meter-long circular walkway, so visitors can view the sheep at all times during their visit. It takes about 40 minutes to walk along this path. A wooden shack located in the field appeared as a backdrop of the movie "The Man from Mars." The wooden shack fits perfectly with the sheep farm, and has become a popular photo site. To get a closer experience with the sheep, sign up for the feeding experience, where you can give hay to the sheep and even reach out to touch their fuzzy heads. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|‚Ä¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)

* May close in the case of adverse weather such as heavy snow, rain or thunderstorms; please call in advance.| |usetime:|November-February 09:00-17:00
March & October 09:00-17:30
April & September 09:00-18:00

* Hours are subject to change depending on weather or conditions on-site.| ## Detail Info | | | | - | - | |Shopping Information:|Food & gifts available| |Parking Fees:|Free| |Admission Fees:|[Individuals]

* Seniors citizens: ID required| |Restrooms:|Available| |Available Facilities:|Sheep feeding area, royal azalea field, thached-roof house, marsh, walking trails, rest area, etc.| |Reservation Info. for Natives:|Reservations not accepted| ## Detail Image ![/2022-07-25-1658777504093/1583621_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658777504093/1583621_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658777504093/1583624_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658777504093/1583624_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658777504093/1583625_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658777504093/1583625_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658777504093/1583627_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658777504093/1583627_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658777504093/1890726_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658777504093/1890726_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658777504093/1890727_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658777504093/1890727_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658777504093/1890728_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658777504093/1890728_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658777504093/1890729_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658777504093/1890729_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658777504093/1890731_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658777504093/1890731_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [‚òéÔ∏è+82-33-335-1966](tel:+82333351966) - [üè†www.yangtte.co.kr]( http://www.yangtte.co.kr) ```googleMap latitude: 37.6876427505 longitude: 128.7533288363 title: 483-32, Daegwallyeongmaru-gil, Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon-do ``` ## Directions [Bus + Taxi]
From Dong Seoul Bus Terminal, take an intercity bus to Hoenggye Intercity Bus Terminal.
From Hoenggye Bus Terminal, take a taxi to the ranch.

data.title: Daegwallyeong Sheep Ranch (ÎåÄÍ¥ÄÎ†π ÏñëÎñºÎ™©Ïû•)
data.description: Daegwallyeong Sheep Ranch is a privately owned ranch on an area of 195 k„é°. There are many ranches in Pyeongchang, but Daegwallyeong Sheep Ranch is the only ranch that raises sheep. The sheep grazing field is surrounded by a 1.2 meter-long circular walkway, so visitors can view the sheep at all times during their visit. It takes about 40 minutes to walk along this path. A wooden shack located in the field appeared as a backdrop of the movie "The Man from Mars."  The wooden shack fits perfectly with the sheep farm, and has become a popular photo site. To get a closer experience with the sheep, sign up for the feeding experience, where you can give hay to the sheep and even reach out to touch their fuzzy heads.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Lohas Park & Wacapuca (Î°úÌïòÏä§ÌååÌÅ¨&ÏôÄÏπ¥Ìë∏Ïπ¥)
dataList.description: Lohas Garden & WacaPuca is an eco-themed park located 700 meters above sea level in the highlands of Pyeongchang, Gangwon-do Province. Sitting in the most beautiful national forest of Phyeongchang (Total area 3,305,785„é° Structural area 396,694„é°), Lohas Garden offers the most natural scenic views in Korea.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Lee Hyo-seok Culture Village (Ïù¥Ìö®ÏÑùÎ¨∏ÌôîÎßàÏùÑ)
dataList.description:
Lee Hyo-seok Culture Village is the place where the author Lee Hyo-seok (pen name ‚ÄúGasan‚Äù) was born and raised. The village is also the setting of the author‚Äôs novel When the Buckwheat Blossoms,‚Äù one of the most celebrated Korean short stories to date.

In 1990, the village place was designated ‚Äòfirst national cultural village‚Äô by the Ministry of Culture and Tourism. The village is comprised of the authors birth house, a water mill, Gasan Park, Lee Hyo-seok Memorial Hall, and a buckwheat museum. During the peak of the blossoming season in early fall, the annual Lee Hyo-seok Cultural Festival takes place and visitors can enjoy the beautiful scenery of snow-white fields of buckwheat flowers.

Lee Hyo-seok Cultural Festival commemorates the modern Korean writer and features buckwheat-themed programs. Events include a Hyo-seok essay contest, traditional performances, a costume parade, a photo contest, and When the Buckwheat Blossoms plays and related performances. During the festival, visitors can enjoy makguksu (buckwheat noodles) and memil buchim (buckwheat pancakes) and tour the locations that appear in the famous short story.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Korean Peninsula-shaped Cliffs-Gangwon Paleozoic Geopark (ÌïúÎ∞òÎèÑÏßÄÌòï-Í∞ïÏõêÍ≥†ÏÉùÎåÄ Íµ≠Í∞ÄÏßÄÏßàÍ≥µÏõê)
dataList.description: Seonam Village is a small town located on the banks of the Seogang River in Yeongwol, Gangwon-do. The village is famous for its land formation that is shaped like the Korean peninsula, due to the river meandering around the village forming an outline in the shape of the peninsula. In the summer, many people come to enjoy rafting from the East Coast to the West Coast of the peninsula-like cliff formation, with Homigot in the south and Baekdusan Mountain in the North.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Kim Hain Art Hall Pension (ÍπÄÌïòÏù∏ ÏïÑÌä∏ÌôÄ Íµ≠ÌôîÍΩÉÌñ•Í∏∞)
dataList.description: Famous as a filming site for the popular K-drama Autumn in My Heart (2000), Kim Hain Art Hall opened in October 2008 in dedication to Kim Hain, the novelist of The Scent of Love. The center serves as a cultural space for students and general visitors. Spread over four floors, Kim Hain Art Hall doubles as an experience center and a pension, featuring a literature lecture room, author introduction room, a screening room, and moviestar room.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jumunjin Port (Ï£ºÎ¨∏ÏßÑÌï≠)
dataList.description: Jumunjin Port, one of the main fishing ports on the east coast, is home to over 350 fishing boats. The East Sea, where the warm and cold waters meet, is excellent for catching many different types of fish including lance fish, pollack, herring, and anchovy, as well as squid. Fish caught in the area is often served fresh or cooked at nearby seafood restaurants.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jumunjin Lighthouse (Ï£ºÎ¨∏ÏßÑ Îì±ÎåÄ)
dataList.description: Established on March 20, 1918, Jumunjin Lighthouse was the first lighthouse in the Gangwon region. The lighthouse is 3 meters in diameter at the base and 10 meters in x_height with white mortar covering the exterior wall. The building shows the early structure of Korean lighthouse architecture, which is a great value in terms of the nation‚Äôs architectural history. The light signal blinks at 15-second intervals and can be seen from 37 kilometers away. The original lighthouse was destroyed during the Korean War but was rebuilt in 1951.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jumunjin Breakwater (Ï£ºÎ¨∏ÏßÑ Î∞©ÏÇ¨Ï†ú)
dataList.description: Jumunjin Breakwater was built to protect the coastline from the effects of erosion and longshore drift. It became a popular attraction after its first appearance in the television drama Guardian (2016) as many visitors look forward to taking photos of a scene reanactment from the drama.
dataList.author: korea-tour
